definition: Hinweg is typically used to indicate movement or passage from one side or location to another, often implying a sense of crossing or traversing a physical or metaphorical boundary. It can also convey the idea of overcoming or surpassing something, as well as the notion of leaving something behind or moving beyond it.

examples.german: Er ging hinweg, ohne sich umzudrehen.
examples.english: He walked away without looking back.

examples.german: Sie schob ihre Zweifel beiseite und ging hinweg.
examples.english: She pushed her doubts aside and walked away.

examples.german: Der Schmerz wird mit der Zeit hinweggehen.
examples.english: The pain will fade away with time.

examples.german: Er konnte nicht Ã¼ber den Verlust hinwegkommen.
examples.english: He couldn't get over the loss.
